intro: Acyntha thyrsiflora, commonly known as the thyrso-flowered acyntha, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Boraginaceae. It is characterized by its compact, low-growing habit and produces clusters of small, blue or violet flowers arranged in thyrsiform inflorescences. The plant has hairy, lance-shaped leaves that are often glandular, contributing to its distinctive appearance. It is native to southern Africa and thrives in dry, rocky soils. Acyntha thyrsiflora is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is relatively easy to care for in suitable growing conditions.
